index.headline1: MMDA: An interactive toolkit for Corpus-based Discourse Analysis
index.paragraph1: Corpus-based Discourse Analysis (CDA) is a popular and highly successful technique for the investigation of socio-political research questions.  The CDA procedure typically starts from a keyword analysis for a (sub-)corpus or a collocation analysis for a given node (oftentimes representing a topic of interest).  The keywords and collocates are then grouped into semantically meaningful categories (e.g. attitudes and opinions) based on careful inspection of the corresponding KWIC concordances. We call these categories 'discoursemes'.
index.paragraph2: The web application you are using here – the interactive Mixed Methods Discourse Analysis (MMDA) toolkit – is a bespoke software solution that combines the core steps of CDA into a single consistent and efficient working environment. The most labour-intensive task of CDA, the manual grouping of lexical items into discoursemes, can be carried out interactively via drag & drop.
index.paragraph3: From a Digital Humanities perspective, the toolkit can be understood as an attempt to blend close and distant reading techniques.  On the one hand, the app provides an intuitive visualization of keywords and collocation profiles in form of a semantic map.   On the other, easily accessible and exportable concordance lines accompany all summarizations.
index.paragraph4: See the Vignette for further info or start with a Discourseme Analysis.
